info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 1:35PM PDT until July 31 at 3:00PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHEASTERN INYO AND SAN BERNARDINO COUNTIES... At 135 PM PDT, At 115 PM, CHP reported roadway flooding on Highway 190 in Death Valley. The highway is reported as impassable and has been closed between Death Valley Junction and Furnace Creek. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Furnace Creek, Stovepipe Wells, Shoshone, Texas Springs Campground, Death Valley Junction and Homewood Canyon-Valley Wells. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
